newsitem.title: THAILAND: Thai PTT buys JDA natgas at $2.30 per mln BTU.
newsitem.headline: Thai PTT buys JDA natgas at $2.30 per mln BTU.

text.p: Thailand's state-run Petroleum Authority of Thailand agreed to buy natural gas from the Thai-Malaysian Joint Development Area at a well-head price of $2.30 per million BTU, a senior PTT official said on Thursday.

Vichit Yamboonruang, PTT's executive director for Exploration, Petroleum and Gas sector, told reporters that PTT will sign a purchase agreement to buy natural gas from A-18 offshore field soon, probably in July.
The agreement was made with Triton Oil Co which holds 50 percent stake in the field, he said.
According to sources from PTT, Thailand wanted to buy 500-1,000 million cubic feet per day, starting 1999.
Malaysia-Thailand Joint Authority (MTJA) was set up in 1990 to jointly explore and develop petroleum resources in the desinated JDA.

In 1994, MTJA signed a production sharing contract with a group of petroleum companies comprising Triton Oil Co, Petronas Carigali and PTT Exploration International, giving them exploratory and development rights over three offshore fields -- A-18, B-17 and C-19.
Negotiation is still ongoing on possible natural gas purchase from B-17, C-19 fields.
